content:
Currently when a user is in root domain and try to access /login or /signup they would be redirected to find accounts page. This is not the ideal workflow. Instead of this the users should be taken to a page that allows them to enter the subdomain of the organization and redirects the /login and /signup page of the organization. What should be the url of this page which allows users to jump to any organization by entering the subdomain?

enter-realm.gif

The GIF uses /enter as the URL of the page.

I totally agree. This is super confusing as a user. Find accounts makes no sense to someone without clearer explanation on the fact that zulip hosts some realms and they are sign-up only right now. Not sure if we plan on having any public facing test/demo realms ( perhaps separate from this one, or maybe the public facing aspects will be limited to some streams. I've seen that feature requested on here recently. ).

I think just a bit more explanation around this and adding a "Sign in" button would be a good start. You could link to Find Accounts from page @Vishnu Ks has setup but it seems secondary.

Maybe /accounts/go?
And yeah, as a V2 this page can have something like "Forgot your Zulip URL? Click here to get a reminder." that goes to our current /accounts/find
